items.title: GST Rate Slabs in India
items.content: India follows a 4-tier GST rate structure: 0% (Nil) - Essential items like fresh vegetables, milk, cereals, eggs, newspapers. 5% - Common use items like edible oil, sugar, tea, coffee, spices, coal, medicines. 12% - Computers, processed food, mobile phones (some), butter, ghee, cheese. 18% - Most goods and services fall here - soaps, toothpaste, industrial intermediaries, capital goods, telecom, IT services, restaurants. 28% - Luxury and sin goods - ACs, refrigerators, cars, tobacco products, aerated drinks, cement. Additional cess on certain items like automobiles and luxury goods.

items.title: GST Registration Threshold
items.content: Mandatory GST registration required if aggregate turnover exceeds: ₹40 lakhs for supply of goods (₹20 lakhs for special category states), ₹20 lakhs for supply of services (₹10 lakhs for special category states). Voluntary registration allowed below threshold. Special category states include: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Jammu & Kashmir, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim, Tripura, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand.
